page.title: 17Shopping Patterns
page.content: The village of Billingshurst provides the area with a good base for everyday shopping.{Post offices, banks and {newsagents}make up a busy high street. {Jewellers, antique shops, clothes {stores, a sports shop & supermarkets } (a new one is being built on the site of a former garage), complete the picture. However for irregular shopping such as clothes, shoes, furniture, bedding etc, most people travel to{Horsham,Worthing, Crawley, {or Brighton,}where the range of stores is much greater. Apart from the supermarkets, prices are a little higher than in the surrounding towns but the cost of transport is high {(petrol is Â£2 per gallon)}and so the shops have a captive market. Whilst the district is self-sufficient it does not act as magnet. { }
